item.text: “‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: The gate of the inner court that faces east will be closed six working days, but on the Sabbath day it will be opened and on the day of the new moon it will be opened.

The <st data-num="05387" class="">prince</st> will <st data-num="0935" class="">enter</st> by <st data-num="01870" class="">way</st> of the <st data-num="0197" class="">porch</st> of the <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st> from the <st data-num="02351" class="">outside</st> and will <st data-num="05975" class="">stand</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="04201" class="">doorpost</st> of the <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st>. The <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> will <st data-num="06213" class="">provide</st> his <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st> and his <st data-num="08002" class="">peace offerings</st>, and he will <st data-num="07812" class="">bow down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="04670" class="">threshold</st> of the <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st> and then <st data-num="03318" class="">go out</st>. But the <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="05462" class="">closed</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>.
The people of the land will bow down at the entrance of that gate before the Lord on the Sabbaths and on the new moons.
The burnt offering that the prince will offer to the Lord on the Sabbath day will be six unblemished lambs and one unblemished ram.

The <st data-num="04503" class="">grain offering</st> will be an <st data-num="0374" class="">ephah</st> with the <st data-num="0352" class="">ram</st>, and the <st data-num="04503" class="">grain offering</st> with the <st data-num="03532" class="">lambs</st> will be <st data-num="03027" class="">as much as</st> he <st data-num="03027" class="">is able</st> to <st data-num="04991" class="">give</st>,<n id="1" /> and a <st data-num="01969" class="">gallon</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st> with an <st data-num="0374" class="">ephah</st>.

On the <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> of the <st data-num="02320" class="">new moon</st> he will offer<n id="1" /> an <st data-num="08549" class="">unblemished</st> <st data-num="01121 01241">young</st> <st data-num="06499" class="">bull</st> and <st data-num="08337" class="">six</st> <st data-num="03532" class="">lambs</st> and a <st data-num="0352" class="">ram</st>, <st data-num="01961" class="">all</st> <st data-num="08549" class="">without blemish</st>.

He will <st data-num="06213" class="">provide</st> a <st data-num="04503" class="">grain offering</st>: an <st data-num="0374" class="">ephah</st> with the <st data-num="06499" class="">bull</st> and an <st data-num="0374" class="">ephah</st> with the <st data-num="0352" class="">ram</st>, and with the <st data-num="03532" class="">lambs</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">as much as</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">he</st> <st data-num="05381" class="">wishes</st>,<n id="1" /> and a <st data-num="01969" class="">gallon</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st> with each <st data-num="0374" class="">ephah</st> of grain.<n id="3" />
When the prince enters, he will come by way of the porch of the gate and will go out the same way.

“‘When the people of the land come before the Lord at the appointed feasts, whoever enters by way of the north gate to worship will go out by way of the south gate; whoever enters by way of the south gate will go out by way of the north gate. No one will return by way of the gate they entered but will go out straight ahead.
When they come in, the prince will come in with them, and when they go out, he will go out.

“‘At the festivals and at the appointed feasts the grain offering will be an ephah with the bull and an ephah with the ram, and with the lambs as much as one is able, and a gallon of olive oil with each ephah of grain.

When the prince provides a freewill offering, a burnt offering, or peace offerings as a voluntary offering to the Lord, the gate facing east will be opened for him, and he will provide his burnt offering and his peace offerings just as he did on the Sabbath. Then he will go out, and the gate will be closed after he goes out.
“‘You will provide a lamb a year old without blemish for a burnt offering daily to the Lord; morning by morning he will provide it.

And you will provide a grain offering with it morning by morning, a sixth of an ephah and a third of a gallon of olive oil to moisten the choice flour, as a grain offering to the Lord; this is a perpetual statute.
Thus they will provide the lamb, the grain offering, and the olive oil morning by morning as a perpetual burnt offering.
“‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: If the prince should give a gift to one of his sons as his inheritance, it will belong to his sons; it is their property by inheritance.

But <st data-num="03588" class="">if</st> he <st data-num="05414" class="">gives</st> a <st data-num="04979" class="">gift</st> from his <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> to <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>, it will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> his <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> of <st data-num="01865" class="">liberty</st>;<n id="1" /> then it will <st data-num="07725" class="">revert</st> to the <st data-num="05387" class="">prince</st>. His <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> will <st data-num="0389" class="">only</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">remain</st> with his <st data-num="01121 01992">sons</st>.

The prince will not take away any of the people’s inheritance by oppressively removing them from their property. He will give his sons an inheritance from his own possessions so that my people will not be scattered, each from his own property.’”
Then he brought me through the entrance, which was at the side of the gate, into the holy chambers for the priests, which faced north. There I saw a place at the extreme western end.

He said to me, “This is the place where the priests will boil the guilt offering and the sin offering and where they will bake the grain offering, so that they do not bring them out to the outer court to transmit holiness to the people.”
Then he brought me out to the outer court and led me past the four corners of the court, and I noticed that in every corner of the court there was another court.

In the <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="04740" class="">corners</st> of the <st data-num="02691" class="">court</st> were <st data-num="07000" class=""> small</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="02691" class="">courts</st>, <st data-num="0705" class="">70</st> feet<n id="2" /> in <st data-num="0753" class="">length</st> and <st data-num="07970" class="">52½</st> feet<n id="3" /> in <st data-num="07341" class="">width</st>; the <st data-num="0702 07106">four</st> were all the <st data-num="0259" class="">same</st> <st data-num="04060" class="">size</st>.

There was a <st data-num="02905" class="">row of masonry</st> <st data-num="05439 05439">around</st> each of the <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> courts, and <st data-num="04018" class="">places for boiling offerings</st> were <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> the <st data-num="02918" class="">rows</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">all around</st>.
Then he said to me, “These are the houses for boiling, where the ministers of the temple boil the sacrifices of the people.”
